title: New charges made after 16-year-old dies from shooting injuries
content:
OTTUMWA, Iowa —
An 18-year-old faces murder charges in connection with a November shooting.
Ottumwa police said Venhure Yosef Tsegay was charged Tuesday with first-degree murder.
Police said the charges stem from a November 29 shooting involving 16-year-old Christian Madueno, who was shot in the face with a handgun.
Madueno died on December 25 as a result of his injuries, according to police.
Tsegay had previously been charged with attempted murder and robbery in this incident.
He is being held in the Wapello County Jail on $500,000 cash-only bond.
